writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
Nico sprawled across our bed like a dark, brooding cloud, refusing to budge. I chuckled and rolled my eyes, accustomed to this morning ritual. "Come on, sunshine. We've got a day to live."

He grumbled, his voice muffled by the pillow, and I knew I was in for a fight. I gently tugged on the blankets, and he wrapped them tighter around himself, his face still hidden. "I'm not going anywhere. I'm a demigod, Will. I don't do mornings."

I grinned and pounced on him, wrapping my arms around him in a bear hug. "That's because you're a lazy demigod. Now, let's get up and start the day."

The pillow fight that ensued was epic. I managed to dislodge a few pillows, but Nico held onto the others like a lifeline. Finally, I surrendered, laughing as he emerged from the pile of pillows, triumphant.

We stumbled out of bed, a tangled mess of arms and legs, and made our way to the kitchen. Nico poured himself a cup of coffee, and I cracked eggs into a pan, sizzling them on the stove.

As we ate, our conversation turned to the usual morning topics: music, plans for the day, and who was going to do the dishes. It was a comfortable, easy rhythm, one I'd grown accustomed to over the years.

But then, Nico said it. The thing that would change everything.

"Hey, Will?" He turned to me, his eyes sparkling with mischief. "I was thinking... we should start the day with a ritual."

I raised an eyebrow. "A ritual? What kind of ritual?"

Nico's grin was infectious. "A magical one, of course. We can make it a thing, like a morning tradition. It'll be fun, I promise."

I set down my fork, intrigued. "What did you have in mind?"

Nico's eyes lit up. "We can draw magical symbols on the kitchen wall with our fingers. It'll protect us from, you know, monsters and stuff. And we can say a little incantation together. It'll be our thing."

I stared at him, a mix of amusement and curiosity on my face. "You want to draw magical symbols on the kitchen wall?"

Nico nodded enthusiastically. "Yeah! It'll be like a secret handshake, but magical."

I couldn't resist his excitement. "Okay, fine. But if we get in trouble for vandalism, I'm blaming you."

We spent the next hour practicing our incantation and perfecting our symbol-drawing skills. It was ridiculous, and I loved every minute of it. As we finished up, Nico turned to me, his eyes shining with happiness.

"See? I told you it would be fun."

I smiled, wrapping my arms around him. "It's not just fun, Nico. It's us. It's our thing."

And as we stood there, surrounded by the symbols we'd drawn and the magic we'd created, I knew that this was just the beginning of something new and wonderful.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I settled onto the couch, watching as Will expertly flipped a pancake in the skillet. The aroma wafting from the kitchen was heavenly, and my stomach growled in anticipation. Will chuckled and slid the plate in front of me. "Eat, I'll get the coffee."

As I dug in, my fingers brushed against Will's phone, which was lying on the coffee table. I smiled, remembering his words from last week: "You can look through my phone anytime, baby. I trust you."

I picked up the phone, scrolling through Will's social media feeds as I ate. Nothing out of the ordinary – a few posts from his friends, some silly memes, and a few photos from our recent vacation. I was about to put the phone down when I saw a folder labeled "Candid Moments." My curiosity piqued, I opened it.

The first photo showed me sleeping on the couch, a snore escaping my lips. I laughed, remembering how I'd fallen asleep mid-conversation. The next photo was of me attempting to cook breakfast – a mess of eggs and toast, with Will looking on in amusement.

As I scrolled through the folder, I realized each photo captured a moment I hadn't even realized was special. There was the time I'd surprised Will with his favorite dessert, the look on his face a mix of delight and surprise. There was the photo of us walking hand in hand on the beach, the sunset casting a golden glow over the waves. And the one of me reading to Will from my favorite childhood book, his eyes shining with wonder.

I felt a lump form in my throat as I continued to scroll. These photos weren't just random captures – they were moments Will had deliberately taken, moments he'd deemed special enough to save. I thought back to his words: "You can look through my phone anytime, baby." It wasn't just about trust; it was about him wanting me to see these moments, to appreciate them as he did.

I looked up to find Will standing in the kitchen doorway, a cup of coffee in his hand and a knowing smile on his face. "Find something interesting?" he asked, his voice low and husky.

I nodded, my voice caught in my throat. "I see you've been documenting my life."

Will chuckled and walked over to the couch, setting the coffee down beside me. "I like to think of it as a secret art project," he said, his eyes sparkling with mirth.

I turned to him, my heart full. "You're the best artist I know," I said, my voice barely above a whisper.

Will's smile softened, and he leaned in to kiss me. "I'm just trying to capture the beauty in our everyday moments," he said, his lips brushing against mine.

As we sat there, surrounded by the warmth and love of our home, I realized that these candid moments were more than just photos – they were a testament to our love, a reminder that even in the mundane, there was beauty to be found.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
"Come on, Will, it'll be fun," I said, trying to hide my excitement behind a mask of nonchalance. "Just one video. For my portfolio. I promise it'll be nothing out of the ordinary." I leaned against the makeup counter, eyeing my reluctant partner with a mischievous grin. Will raised an eyebrow, his skepticism clear.

"Nothing out of the ordinary?" he repeated, his voice dripping with doubt. "You've been working on this for weeks. I've seen the cryptic messages on your phone, the late-night Google searches... I know exactly what you're planning."

I chuckled, feigning innocence. "Oh, no, no, no. Nothing like that. I just want to practice my skills, that's all." I held up a tube of glittery eyeshadow, waving it at him like a magic wand. "I promise I won't turn you into a unicorn or anything."

Will shook his head, a small smile playing on his lips. "You're not even listening to yourself, Nico. If it's just a normal makeup look, why do you need me to sit still for an hour?"

I shrugged, my mind racing with possibilities. I had a vision, one that involved a dash of magic, a pinch of whimsy, and a healthy dose of humor. "Because, my love, I need a model who can appreciate the art of transformation. And who better to appreciate it than the love of my life?"

Will raised an eyebrow, a hint of teasing in his voice. "You're really selling this, aren't you?"

I beamed with pride. "I'm a professional, Will. A master of my craft. Now, come on, let's get started. I promise it'll be worth it."

With a sigh, Will relented, taking a seat in front of the mirror. I set to work, my hands moving with a life of their own as I applied layer upon layer of makeup. Will watched in the mirror, his eyes growing wider as the transformation took hold.

Finally, I stepped back to reveal my masterpiece: Will, resplendent in a glittering green and purple mermaid tail, complete with scales and a pair of shimmering seashells for hair clips.

Will's jaw dropped. "Nico, what... how...?"

I grinned, triumphant. "Ta-da! I told you it'd be worth it."

Will stared at his reflection, his eyes scanning the mermaid tail in horror. Then, to my surprise, he burst out laughing. "Oh, Nico. You sneaky, mischievous artist. You did it again, didn't you?"

I beamed with pride, pulling Will into a tight hug. "I told you it'd be fun. Now, let's get one thing straight: if we're going to do a video, it's going to be a comedy sketch. And I'm not just talking about the makeup."

Will chuckled, his eyes sparkling with amusement. "You're on, my love. But next time, can we please just stick to a simple smoky eye?"

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
I navigated the Labyrinth with a practiced ease, my eyes scanning the twisting paths and echoing corridors as I made my way deeper into the heart of the maze. The cold stone walls seemed to whisper secrets in my ear, and I tuned them out, focusing on the task at hand. I had a mission to complete, and I couldn't afford to get distracted.

My map lay spread out on the ground in front of me, the intricate paths and symbols etched into its surface a reminder of the countless times I'd navigated this labyrinthine world. I muttered to myself, a habit I'd developed over the years, as I checked my route for the hundredth time. It was a habit that usually helped me stay focused, but today it just made me feel like I was trapped in a never-ending loop.

As I rounded a corner, I caught sight of a boy perched on a nearby rock, his bright blue eyes fixed intently on me. He was freckled, with a smattering of darker spots across his nose and cheeks that made him look like a walking star map. He was also holding a small device in his hand that looked suspiciously like a futuristic gadget.

"Hey, you're Nico," he said, his voice a bright, cheerful thing that cut through the gloom of the Labyrinth like a ray of sunlight.

I raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite myself. "How do you know my name?"

The boy grinned, a mischievous glint in his eye. "I'm from the future, Nico. And I'm your boyfriend."

I blinked, my mind stuttering to a halt. "Your boyfriend?"

The boy nodded, his grin growing wider. "Yeah, it's a long story. But trust me, we're going to be awesome together."

I stared at him, my skepticism written all over my face. "You expect me to believe that you're from the future and we're going to be a couple?"

The boy chuckled, his eyes crinkling at the corners. "Well, when you put it that way, it sounds a bit far-fetched. But hear me out. I'm from a future where demigods and monsters coexist in a world of magic and technology. And in that future, you and I are together."

I raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite myself. "Go on."

The boy launched into a breathless explanation of his time-traveling device, the futuristic gadgets he'd brought with him, and the complexities of the timeline. I listened, a mix of fascination and skepticism warring within me.

As he spoke, I found myself drawn to the boy's enthusiasm, his confidence, and his quirky sense of humor. He was like a ray of sunshine in the midst of the Labyrinth's darkness, and I couldn't help but feel a spark of connection with him.

When he finished speaking, I looked at him, my eyes searching for any sign of deception. But all I saw was sincerity, and a deep longing in his eyes that made my heart skip a beat.

"I don't know if I believe you," I said finally, my voice barely above a whisper.

The boy nodded, his grin still in place. "I knew you'd be skeptical. But that's okay. I'm willing to wait for you, Nico. I'm willing to spend the rest of eternity waiting for you to come around."

I felt a shiver run down my spine as he spoke, his words echoing through the Labyrinth like a promise. And for the first time in a long time, I felt a glimmer of hope, a sense that maybe, just maybe, this strange, freckled boy from the future was the key to unlocking a brighter future for me.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
The kitchen clock ticked away, its steady beat a stark contrast to the chaos that still lingered in our minds. I stood at the counter, staring blankly at the refrigerator as the hum of the motor grew louder, echoing the turmoil in my head. Nico's hand wrapped around mine, his fingers intertwining with mine as he pulled me back into the warmth of our kitchen. The soft glow of the light overhead cast gentle shadows on the walls, a stark contrast to the darkness we'd faced in Tartarus.

"You okay?" he asked, his voice low and soothing. I nodded, but couldn't shake the feeling of unease that had been plaguing me since we'd escaped the underworld. Nico must have sensed it, because he pulled me into a gentle hug. "We're safe, Will. We're home."

I felt a small smile creep onto my face as I wrapped my arms around him, holding him close. We stood there for a moment, swaying gently to the rhythm of the refrigerator's hum. The kitchen was our sanctuary, our safe haven from the horrors we'd faced. We'd developed quiet rituals to soothe our lingering fears, and this was one of them – dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of our shared past faded into the rhythm of the present.

Nico started to move, his hips swaying to the beat of some unheard melody. I laughed, feeling a weight lift off my shoulders as I let myself get caught up in the moment. We danced, our movements fluid and instinctive, like we'd done this a thousand times before. The kitchen transformed around us, the ordinary space becoming a magical retreat where our fears disappeared and our love shone bright.

As we twirled, the radio in the corner of the kitchen caught our attention. A soft, soothing melody filled the air, and Nico's eyes lit up. "Oh, it's that song again," he exclaimed, his voice full of excitement. I smiled, remembering the countless times we'd danced to this same song in our kitchen, surrounded by the memories of our past.

We danced some more, lost in the rhythm and the moment. The kitchen clock ticked away, but we didn't notice. All that mattered was the beat of our hearts, the warmth of our bodies pressed together, and the love that flowed between us like a river.

As the song faded away, Nico leaned in close, his lips brushing against my ear. "You know, this kitchen dance floor is the safest place I've ever been," he whispered, his voice full of conviction. I smiled, feeling a sense of peace wash over me. "Me too," I replied, my voice barely above a whisper.

In this moment, nothing else mattered. Our past, our fears, our doubts – all of it faded into the background as we stood there, wrapped in each other's arms, our love shining bright like a beacon of hope in the darkness. And as we stood there, swaying gently to the rhythm of the present, I knew that we would face whatever came next, together, as long as we had each other.

The kitchen clock ticked away, but we didn't notice. All that mattered was the beat of our hearts, and the love that flowed between us like a river.
